titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney. Inventory prepared by Brian Carpenter.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:19-0400

did.abstract: This collection includes word lists, history, and texts (some with translation). Informants were Pedro Estrella Tánori and María Córdova, both of Onabas, Sonora, Mexico.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by John R. Cornell and accessioned, 1971 (Acc. 1971 855r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John R. Cornell, the recipient of an American Philosophical Society Phillips Fund grant, created the collection.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Pima Bajo word list and interview

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pima Bajo word elicitation up through approximately 15:00, followed by an interview on the current Pima Indian population.

did.unittitle: Pima Bajo word list and history

scopecontent.p: Brief word list, followed by interview on the current Pima Indian population. Predominantly in Spanish.
